English: The words of the Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r 'bok bơtho, sư kon drŏ-nglo Đawit, pơtao oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: “Vanity of vanities,” says the Preacher; “Vanity of vanities, all is vanity.”
Bahnar: 'Bok mă bơtho noh khan: “Đĭ-đăng dôm tơdrong ưh kơ yua kiơ̆ hloi, tơdrong kơđei ngăl. Ưh kơ đei bu kĕ hlôh tôm tơdrong lăm chăl arih bơ̆n.”

English: What profit has a man from all his labor In which he toils under the sun?
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong kon bơngai jang gleh hrat lăm ala teh 'nâu, hăm đei yua kiơ̆ ưh!

English: One generation passes away, and another generation comes; But the earth abides forever.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng chăl 'nâu, truh tơ chăl nai, mă-lei teh 'nâu oei oei khŏm khŏm đĕch.

English: The sun also rises, and the sun goes down, And hastens to the place where it arose.
Bahnar: 'Năr lĕch, đơ̆ng noh 'năr mơ̆t, sư wơ̆t hơlơ̆k tơ anih đêl sư lĕch noh dơ̆ng.

English: The wind goes toward the south, And turns around to the north; The wind whirls about continually, And comes again on its circuit.
Bahnar: Kial tơthu tơ gah gơal, wơ̆t tơ gah yă-nơ̆m, sư wơ̆t wih ưh kơ pơdơh, đơ̆ng noh wơ̆t tơ đêl trong sư blŭng-a dơ̆ng.

English: All the rivers run into the sea, Yet the sea is not full; To the place from which the rivers come, There they return again.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng đak krong ro truh tơ đak dơsĭ ngăl, mă-lei ưh kơ kĕ kơ 'bĕnh; sư wơ̆t hơlơ̆k dơ̆ng tơ đêl anih sư lĕch blŭng-a noh.

English: All things are full of labor; Man cannot express it. The eye is not satisfied with seeing, Nor the ear filled with hearing.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng tôm tơmam oei oei hơnơ̆ng, 'bơ̆r kon bơngai ưh kơ gơh roi ôh; măt lăng ưh kơ bơ̆l, đon mơ̆ng ưh kơ hăl.

English: That which has been is what will be, That which is done is what will be done, And there is nothing new under the sun.
Bahnar: Tơdrong kiơ hlôi đei boih, tơdrong noh tơ anăp oei đei; tơdrong kiơ mă hlôi pơm boih, tơdrong noh oei pơm dơ̆ng; ưh kơ đei kiơ̆ 'nao lăm ala teh 'nâu.

English: Is there anything of which it may be said, “See, this is new”? It has already been in ancient times before us.
Bahnar: Dah đei minh pôm tơmam kiơ mă đe khan: “Lăng bĕ, tơmam 'nâu 'nao,” mă tơpă tơmam noh sư hlôi đei đơ̆ng lu chăl adrol kơ lu bơ̆n sơ̆ boih.

English: There is no remembrance of former things, Nor will there be any remembrance of things that are to come By those who will come after.
Bahnar: Đe ưh pă 'blŏk boih lu chăl adrol sơ̆, lu bơngai truh đơ̆ng rŏng kư̆m ưh kơ 'blŏk lu chăl adrol noh mơ̆n.

English: I, the Preacher, was king over Israel in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Inh boih 'bok bơtho, hlôi pơm pơtao lu bơngai Isơrael lăm pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And I set my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all that is done under heaven; this burdensome task God has given to the sons of man, by which they may be exercised.
Bahnar: Inh nŏng kơ yua tơdrong gơh hơgei wă tơchĕng pơwao dôm tơdrong jang tơ ala teh âu; noh jơ̆ minh tơdrong gleh hrat mă 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjao boih kơ kon bơngai wă kơ jang.

English: I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and indeed, all is vanity and grasping for the wind.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh boih dôm tơdrong đei jang tơ ala teh âu; đĭ-đăng tơdrong kơ đei ngăl, mơ̆ng kơ kial bơbơ̆t tơ yơ kiơ̆ tơ noh.

English: What is crooked cannot be made straight, And what is lacking cannot be numbered.
Bahnar: Tơdrong kiơ hlôi đŏng boih, ưh kơ gơh 'bơ̆ jing tơpăt dơ̆ng păng tơmam kiơ ưh kơ đei kư̆m ưh kơ đei.

English: I communed with my heart, saying, “Look, I have attained greatness, and have gained more wisdom than all who were before me in Jerusalem. My heart has understood great wisdom and knowledge.”
Bahnar: Inh pơma lăm to khan: “Âu inh đei boih tơdrong hơgei tih hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă oei adrol kơ inh tơ pơlei Jêrusalem. Jơhngơ̆m inh 'bôh tơpă boih lơ tơdrong hlôh băt, gơh hơgei.”

English: And I set my heart to know wisdom and to know madness and folly. I perceived that this also is grasping for the wind.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m nŏng kơ hŏk wă kơ băt tơdrong hơgei păng wă kơ băt tơdrong kơtul bơlŭk; inh băt kơnăl tơdrong noh kư̆m mơ̆ng kơ kial bơbơ̆t tơ yơ, sư kiơ̆ tơ noh.

English: For in much wisdom is much grief, And he who increases knowledge increases sorrow.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdah đei tơdrong gơh hơgei lơ, tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon kư̆m lơ, bu hlôh băt roi lơ, bơngai noh gô chhŭr nuih rai lơ.

English: I said in my heart, “Come now, I will test you with mirth; therefore enjoy pleasure”; but surely, this also was vanity.
Bahnar: Inh pơma lăm to: “Inh pơlong hiôk chơt 'nă hal lăng 'mơ̆i, lăng lăng hăm đei kiơ hiôk. “Mă-lei inh 'bôh tơdrong noh kư̆m jơ̆ tơdrong kơ đei mơ̆n.

English: I said of laughter—“Madness!”; and of mirth, “What does it accomplish?”
Bahnar: Inh khan: Hiĕk 'noh wơnh; chhôk hơnôk kơ kiơ?

English: I searched in my heart how to gratify my flesh with wine, while guiding my heart with wisdom, and how to lay hold on folly, till I might see what was good for the sons of men to do under heaven all the days of their lives.
Bahnar: Inh pơlong et tơdrô wă kơ akâu inh kơdih chơt hiôk, mă-lei tơdrong hơgei oei chông anhăk inh, inh wă lăng lăng tơdrong kiơ 'lơ̆ng 'biơ̆ ăn kơ kon bơngai kơplah 'bơ̆t bơ̆n oei arih 'biơ̆ năr lăm teh đak âu.

English: I made my works great, I built myself houses, and planted myself vineyards.
Bahnar: Inh jang tôm tơdrong; inh pơm hnam pơm mir pơgar pơtăm 'long hơmu.

English: I made myself gardens and orchards, and I planted all kinds of fruit trees in them.
Bahnar: Pơjing pơm mir pơgar 'long sa plei

English: I made myself water pools from which to water the growing trees of the grove.
Bahnar: inh sir sơlŭng să pơm dơnâu mong đak wă ruh mir 'long wơ̆ iung.

English: I acquired male and female servants, and had servants born in my house. Yes, I had greater possessions of herds and flocks than all who were in Jerusalem before me.
Bahnar: Inh răt lu đĭch đam drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn, đơ̆ng noh đĭch đam đei kon hơ'lơ̆p lơ lăm hnam nhôn inh đei khŭl rơmo, khŭl triu lơ hloh kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai pơtao oei tơ pơlei Jêrusalem adrol kơ inh.

English: I also gathered for myself silver and gold and the special treasures of kings and of the provinces. I acquired male and female singers, the delights of the sons of men, and musical instruments of all kinds.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m mong 'măn hu maih păng dôm tơmam gĭt lu pơtao tơ lăm, lu pơlei tih. Inh kư̆m chă pơlung ăn kơ inh kơdih iŏk bơngai drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn hơri, hăm tơdrong hiôk bơngai drŏ-nglo, wă iŏk akăn, akăn kơnhŏng lơ.

English: So I became great and excelled more than all who were before me in Jerusalem. Also my wisdom remained with me.
Bahnar: Thoi noh inh jing mơdrŏng mơng tih hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai oei tơ pơlei Jêrusalem adrol kơ inh; lăm tơdrong, tơdrong gơh hơgei oei oei hăm inh.

English: Whatever my eyes desired I did not keep from them. I did not withhold my heart from any pleasure, For my heart rejoiced in all my labor; And this was my reward from all my labor.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ lê̆ minh tơdrong kiơ mă măt inh 'maih wă, kư̆m ưh kơ sơngah kơ tơdrong kiơ mă jơhngơ̆m hiôk lăp jơhngơ̆m inh hiôk chơt kơ tơdrong đêl inh jang gleh lap păng noh bơih jơ̆ tơdrong mă apah inh đêl tơdrong inh jang gleh.

English: Then I looked on all the works that my hands had done And on the labor in which I had toiled; And indeed all was vanity and grasping for the wind. There was no profit under the sun.
Bahnar: Inh tơchĕng hơlen lăng dôm tơdrong đêl ti inh pơm. Tuh bơuh bơang pă băt dang yơ gleh hrat, inh lăng dôm tơdrong noh jơ̆ tơdrong kơ đei ưh kơ hlôh yua kơ kiơ thoi pơmơ̆ng kơ kial bơbơ̆t sư tơ yơ kiơ̆ tơ noh, kon bơngai ưh kơ đei pơm kiơ mă đei yua lăm ala teh âu.

English: Then I turned myself to consider wisdom and madness and folly; For what can the man do who succeeds the king?— Only what he has already done.
Bahnar: Inh tơchĕng lăng tơdrong hơgei, tơdrong kơtul kơwao wơnh bơlŭk. Bơngai tơplih pơtao, sư gơh pơm kiơ̆ kơ sư jang kư̆m thoi pơtao sơ̆ đĕch

English: Then I saw that wisdom excels folly As light excels darkness.
Bahnar: inh 'bôh tơdrong hơgei, sư yua 'biơ̆ kơ tơdrong kơtul, kư̆m thoi hơdah sư yua 'biơ̆ kơ măng mu.

English: The wise man’s eyes are in his head, But the fool walks in darkness. Yet I myself perceived That the same event happens to them all.
Bahnar: Bơngai hơgei sư đei măt hơdah trong sư yak, na bơngai kơtul bơlŭk sư yak chơjơ̆ lăm măng mu. Mă khan lei, inh kư̆m băt 'bar trong noh kư̆m gô tơdrong răm lei-lăi.

English: So I said in my heart, “As it happens to the fool, It also happens to me, And why was I then more wise?” Then I said in my heart, “This also is vanity.”
Bahnar: Na inh khan: “Tơdrong mă truh kơ bơngai kơtul, kư̆m gô truh kơ inh thoi noh mơ̆n; thoi noh, hơgei hloh thoi inh âu đei yua kiơ?” Inh khan kơdih akâu: “Noh tơdrong kơ đei mơ̆n.”

English: For there is no more remembrance of the wise than of the fool forever, Since all that now is will be forgotten in the days to come. And how does a wise man die? As the fool!
Bahnar: Tơpă đe kư̆m ưh kơ 'blŏk kơ bơngai hơgei dah bơngai kơtul ling-lang khŏm khŏm ôh, yua kơ bơ̆n băt lăm năr hơtuch kơnh bơngai hơgei dah bơngai kơtul đe kư̆m hiơt đĭ. Ơ! Bơngai hơgei dah bơngai kơtul kư̆m lôch lei-lăi.

English: Therefore I hated life because the work that was done under the sun was distressing to me, for all is vanity and grasping for the wind.
Bahnar: Lei, inh đĭ areh kơ chăl arih inh, yua kơ dôm tơdrong truh tơ ala teh âu pơm kơ inh pơmat, đĭ-đăng tơdrong ưh kơ đei ưh kơ yua kiơ, thoi gô mơ̆ng kơ kial bơbơ̆t tơ yơ kiơ̆ tơ noh.

English: Then I hated all my labor in which I had toiled under the sun, because I must leave it to the man who will come after me.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m areh dôm tơdrong đêl inh jang pơm pơjing tơ ala teh âu, yua kơ wă pơsư̆ ăn đĭ kơ bơngai đơ̆ng rŏng kơ inh.

English: And who knows whether he will be wise or a fool? Yet he will rule over all my labor in which I toiled and in which I have shown myself wise under the sun. This also is vanity.
Bahnar: Bu băt bơngai noh hơgei dah mă kơtul mă khan thoi yơ, sư gô wei pơgơ̆r dôm tơdrong kiơ mă inh đei pơm yua tơdrong gơh hơgei păng jang gleh hrat inh noh kư̆m kơ đei.

English: Therefore I turned my heart and despaired of all the labor in which I had toiled under the sun.
Bahnar: Inh tơtĭnh lăng tơ rŏng lăng dôm tơdrong đêl inh jang pơm pơjing gleh hrat lăm ala teh âu.

English: For there is a man whose labor is with wisdom, knowledge, and skill; yet he must leave his heritage to a man who has not labored for it. This also is vanity and a great evil.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đei bơngai jang yua tơdrong gơh hơgei, hlôh wao jơhngơ̆m pran pơm pơjing lê̆, đơ̆ng noh wă pơsư̆ mŭk tơmam ăn kơ lu bơngai mă ưh kơ đei jang gleh hrat kiơ, noh kư̆m tơdrong kơ đei păng minh tơdrong klai tơpă.

English: For what has man for all his labor, and for the striving of his heart with which he has toiled under the sun?
Bahnar: Lei, hăm đei yua kiơ kơ bơngai gleh pơmat, hrat jơhngơ̆m nŏng kơ bơ̆jang lăm ala teh âu?

English: For all his days are sorrowful, and his work burdensome; even in the night his heart takes no rest. This also is vanity.
Bahnar: Rim năr tơ'bơ̆p tơdrong chhŭr nuih, tơdrong jang ơh klai; mă kơmăng kơ̆l đon sư kư̆m pă đei pơdơh hiôk. Tơdrong noh kư̆m tơdrong kơ đei.

English: Nothing is better for a man than that he should eat and drink, and that his soul should enjoy good in his labor. This also, I saw, was from the hand of God.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng hloh mă kon bơngai gơh pơm noh sŏng sa, nhă đak păng chơt hiôk lăm tơdrong jang. Inh 'bôh boih tơdrong noh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn.

English: For who can eat, or who can have enjoyment, more than I?
Bahnar: Tơpă dah ưh kơ đei đơ̆ng Kră Yang ăn bu gơh đei sŏng sa, gơh hiôk lăm tơdrong jang sư.

English: For God gives wisdom and knowledge and joy to a man who is good in His sight; but to the sinner He gives the work of gathering and collecting, that he may give to him who is good before God. This also is vanity and grasping for the wind.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn tơdrong hơgei hlôh băt păng ăn hiôk chơt kơ đe bu mă pơm trŏ thoi sư lăp đon; mă-lei sư ăn kơ lu bơngai yoch khŏm jang gleh hrat na gơh đei tơmam, mong 'măn lê̆, đơ̆ng noh ăn kơ lu bơngai pơm trŏ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon, tơdrong noh kư̆m tơdrong kơ đei, gô mơ̆ng kơ kial bơbơ̆t tơ yơ kiơ̆ tơ noh.

English: To everything there is a season, A time for every purpose under heaven
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng tôm tơdrong đei hơgăt lê̆ khei 'năr ngăl; rim tơdrong lăm ala teh âu đei hơgăt lê̆ khei 'năr boih.

English: A time to be born, And a time to die; A time to plant, And a time to pluck what is planted
Bahnar: Đei năr tơpŭ, đei khei năr lôch; Đei năr pơtăm, đei khei năr kĕch yuă

English: A time to kill, And a time to heal; A time to break down, And a time to build up
Bahnar: Đei năr pơlôch, đei năr ming pơklaih; Đei năr pơrăm, đei năr pơm tơiung

English: A time to weep, And a time to laugh; A time to mourn, And a time to dance
Bahnar: Đei năr nhơ̆m hmoi, đei năr hiôk chơt; Đei năr ơh sơ'ngon, đei năr hơri suang

English: A time to cast away stones, And a time to gather stones; A time to embrace, And a time to refrain from embracing
Bahnar: Đei năr klơ̆m hŭt lê̆ tơmo, đei năr pơpôi ming tơmo; Đei năr pôk kơ'mĭn, đei năr pră achăng

English: A time to gain, And a time to lose; A time to keep, And a time to throw away
Bahnar: Đei năr chơchă, đei năr sư hiong, Đei khei năr răk mong, đei năr hŭt lê̆

English: A time to tear, And a time to sew; A time to keep silence, And a time to speak
Bahnar: Đei năr hek lê̆, đei năr sĭt ming; Đei năr ngăn, đei năr pơma.

English: A time to love, And a time to hate; A time of war, And a time of peace.
Bahnar: Đei năr 'mêm, đei năr areh; đei năr tơblah, đei rơngei hiôk.

English: What profit has the worker from that in which he labors?
Bahnar: Hăm đei yua kơ lu bơngai mă nŏng kơ jang gleh hrat?

English: I have seen the God-given task with which the sons of men are to be occupied.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh boih tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjao ăn kơ kon bơngai.

English: He has made everything beautiful in its time. Also He has put eternity in their hearts, except that no one can find out the work that God does from beginning to end.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing bơih Sư 'lơ̆ng rŏ ngăl lăm jơ 'năr Sư. Sư kư̆m đei ăn kơ kơ̆l 'ngok kon bơngai băt kơ chăl đơ̆ng rŏng. Mă-lei ưh kơ đei bu kĕ băt hlôh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm đơ̆ng blŭng-a truh tơ ning-mônh.

English: I know that nothing is better for them than to rejoice, and to do good in their lives
Bahnar: Lei na, inh băt 'bôh lăm chăl arih kon bơngai ưh kơ đei kiơ 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ hiôk chơt păng pơm 'lơ̆ng lăm đĭ chăl arih âu.

English: and also that every man should eat and drink and enjoy the good of all his labor—it is the gift of God.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơ̆n athei hiôk mă sŏng sa, nhă, dah lăm tơdrong jang bơ̆n, noh đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei asong ăn.

English: I know that whatever God does, It shall be forever. Nothing can be added to it, And nothing taken from it. God does it, that men should fear before Him.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh băt tôm tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing sư oei đei khŏm khŏm, kon bơngai ưh kơ gơh pơthim tơdrong kiơ păng ưh kơ gơh hơtŭch lê̆ ôh; Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm thoi noh, wă kơ kon bơngai hli yom kơ Sư.

English: That which is has already been, And what is to be has already been; And God requires an account of what is past.
Bahnar: Tơdrong kiơ đei dang ei, noh đei đơ̆ng sơ̆ boih; tơdrong kiơ wă đei noh đei boih: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư pơm lei-lăi thoi Sư pơm boih.

English: Moreover I saw under the sun: In the place of judgment, Wickedness was there; And in the place of righteousness, Iniquity was there.
Bahnar: Inh oei 'bôh dơ̆ng lăm teh đak âu. Lăm tơdrong tơpăt kư̆m đei tơdrong kơnê̆ lăm tơdrong khan tơpăt mă-lei oei đei tơdrong ưh kơ tơpăt.

English: I said in my heart, “God shall judge the righteous and the wicked, For there is a time there for every purpose and for every work.”
Bahnar: Na inh khan: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô sek tơlang kơ lu bơngai pơm 'lơ̆ng păng lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, yua kơ Sư đei hơgăt ăn boih jơ 'năr kơ tôm tơdrong kiơ kiơ.

English: I said in my heart, “Concerning the condition of the sons of men, God tests them, that they may see that they themselves are like animals.”
Bahnar: Inh băt tơpă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơlong lăng kon bơngai, wă kơ lu sư băt, kon bơngai lei-lăi kơ kon sem brem đĕch.

English: For what happens to the sons of men also happens to animals; one thing befalls them: as one dies, so dies the other. Surely, they all have one breath; man has no advantage over animals, for all is vanity.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong kon bơngai đei thoi yơ, kon sem brem đei thoi noh mơ̆n; kon bơngai lôch, kon sem brem kư̆m lôch; 'bar khŭl noh tă kơ dui jơhngơ̆m ngăl, kon bơngai ưh kơ đei kiơ hloh kơ kon sem brem; đĭ-đăng tă kơ tơdrong kơđei ngăl.

English: All go to one place: all are from the dust, and all return to dust.
Bahnar: Pơđĭ kơ bre sư gô brŏk tơ minh anih, đĭ kơ bre sư jing đơ̆ng 'mui teh, đĭ kơ bre sư kư̆m gô brŏk tơ 'mui teh.

English: Who knows the spirit of the sons of men, which goes upward, and the spirit of the animal, which goes down to the earth?
Bahnar: Bu gơh băt tơpă bơhngol kon bơngai păr tŏk tơ plĕnh, dah bơhngol kon sem brem jur tơ teh?

English: So I perceived that nothing is better than that a man should rejoice in his own works, for that is his heritage. For who can bring him to see what will happen after him?
Bahnar: Na inh 'bôh kon bơngai bơ̆n 'lơ̆ng hloh noh athei hiôk chơt lăm tơdrong jang kơdih; noh boih tơdrong apah kơ sư; yua kơ ưh kơ đei bu gơh ba bơ̆n wơ̆t hơlơ̆k 'bôh dơ̆ng dôm tơdrong truh đơ̆ng rŏng kơ bơ̆n lôch.

English: Then I returned and considered all the oppression that is done under the sun: And look! The tears of the oppressed, But they have no comforter— On the side of their oppressors there is power, But they have no comforter.
Bahnar: Inh lăng tơ rŏng, 'bôh dôm tơdrong pơjuă pơđep băl tơ ala teh; to bơngai mă đe pơjuă pơđep nhơ̆m ơh sơ'ngon, ưh kơ đei bu pơlung lu sư! Lu bơngai gơh chă pơjuă pơđep, mă-lei ưh kơ đei bu dŏng pơlung lu bơngai mă đe pơjuă pơđep noh!

English: Therefore I praised the dead who were already dead, More than the living who are still alive.
Bahnar: Inh hiôk kơ lu bơngai lôch, yua kơ sư lôch boih lu sư noh hiôk hloh kơ lu bơngai mă oei arih.

English: Yet, better than both is he who has never existed, Who has not seen the evil work that is done under the sun.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă hiôk hloh kơ 'bar khŭl bơngai noh bơngai mă đe tam mă tơpŭ kơ sư, lu sư tam mă lah 'bôh tơdrong kơnê̆ lăm chăl arih âu.

English: Again, I saw that for all toil and every skillful work a man is envied by his neighbor. This also is vanity and grasping for the wind.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m 'bôh đĭ-đăng tơdrong kon bơngai jang gleh hrat, yua tơdrong gơh hơgei, noh jơ̆ yua kơ tơdrong sư 'ngeng areh klai dih băl. Tơdrong noh kư̆m tơdrong kơ đei, gô mơ̆ng kơ kial bơbơ̆t tơ yơ kiơ̆ tơ noh.

English: The fool folds his hands And consumes his own flesh.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơtul sư kuăr ti ngôi đĕch, noh pơrăm sư kơdih.

English: Better a handful with quietness Than both hands full, together with toil and grasping for the wind.
Bahnar: Kơtrơ̆m jah đei đăi 'bĕnh hơya minh pah tơpang ti đĕch mă-lei đei tơdrong hiôk rơnŭk, noh sư hloh kơ đei 'bĕnh 'bar pah tơpang ti, mă-lei gleh pơmat, mơ̆ng kơ kial bơbơ̆t sư tơ yơ kiơ̆ tơ noh.

English: Then I returned, and I saw vanity under the sun
Bahnar: Na inh, 'bôh tơdrong kơđei ala teh 'nâu.

English: There is one alone, without companion: He has neither son nor brother. Yet there is no end to all his labors, Nor is his eye satisfied with riches. But he never asks, “For whom do I toil and deprive myself of good?” This also is vanity and a grave misfortune.
Bahnar: Thoi minh 'nu bơngai hơdrô̆, ưh kơ đei kon hơ'lơ̆p kư̆m ưh kơ đei 'nhŏng oh; mă-lei nŏng kơ jang adrin gleh hrat ưh pă pơdơh, măt sư lăng tơ mŭk tơmam ưh kơ đei layơ bơ̆l hăl; sư ưh kơ lah tơchĕng khan inh jang gleh hrat, yua kơ bu ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa jơnap hrŭk hơnĭl tơpă jơ̆ tơdrong kơ đei, chăl arih hiơ̆k bơngơ̆t gleh pơmat-tat, tơdrong arih răm-'băm pă kĕ.

English: Two are better than one, Because they have a good reward for their labor.
Bahnar: 'Bar 'nu hloh kơ minh 'nu, yua kơ jang hơdai đei yua kơ 'bar 'nu.

English: For if they fall, one will lift up his companion. But woe to him who is alone when he falls, For he has no one to help him up.
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu pơ̆k minh 'nu tơiung; mơnat 'biơ̆ kơ bơngai hơdrô̆ huŏng, ưh kơ đei bu tơiung!

English: Again, if two lie down together, they will keep warm; But how can one be warm alone?
Bahnar: Kŭm thoi ei, 'bar 'nu 'bĭch hơdai tơtŏ; 'bĭch minh 'nu liơ gơh tơtŏ

English: Though one may be overpowered by another, two can withstand him. And a threefold cord is not quickly broken.
Bahnar: Minh drô̆, 'bônh kơ jei đe, mă-lei dah đei 'bar 'nu pơpôi jơhngơ̆m bu kĕ pơm kơ bre sư; minh dăng tơlei kŭi pêng 'yoi sư hơnat kơ kơtĕch.

English: Better a poor and wise youth Than an old and foolish king who will be admonished no more.
Bahnar: Minh 'nu bơngai 'lơ̆p dơnuh hin, mă-lei hơgei, oei 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ pơtao kră kơtul, ưh kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r đe bơtho tơ'bôh.

English: For he comes out of prison to be king, Although he was born poor in his kingdom.
Bahnar: Bơngai 'lơ̆p 'nao tŏk đơ̆ng sơlŭng đe phak wă pơm pơtao, mă khan đe tơpŭ kơ sư dơnuh hin lăm dêh char sư.

English: I saw all the living who walk under the sun; They were with the second youth who stands in his place.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh đĭ-đăng bơngai arih oei lăm ala teh 'nâu oei lăp kơ 'lơ̆p ngăl, gô pôk sư pơm pơtao.

English: There was no end of all the people over whom he was made king; Yet those who come afterward will not rejoice in him. Surely this also is vanity and grasping for the wind.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei, lu bơngai iung đơ̆ng rŏng, ưh kơ lăp đon, kơ sư. Tơpă noh kư̆m tơdrong kơ đei, gô mơ̆ng kơ kial bơbơ̆t sư tơ yơ kiơ̆ tơ noh.

English: Walk prudently when you go to the house of God; and draw near to hear rather than to give the sacrifice of fools, for they do not know that they do evil.
Bahnar: Kơchăng bĕ mưh ih mơ̆t lăm hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei. Năm mă jê̆ na mơ̆ng, 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ bơngai kơtul pơyơ̆r tơmam soi, lu bơngai mă ưh kơ băt sư đei pơm yoch.

English: Do not be rash with your mouth, And let not your heart utter anything hastily before God. For God is in heaven, and you on earth; Therefore let your words be few.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hăt pơma păng jơhngơ̆m ih 'nĕ kơ hăt hot lĕch nơ̆r pơkă 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei tơ kơpal plĕnh ti, na ih oei tơ ala teh. Lei ih athei wei 'bơ̆r rim nơ̆r pơma mă 'lơ̆ng.

English: For a dream comes through much activity, And a fool’s voice is known by his many words.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng ih hrăn tơtăm na jing apo; kơnê̆ đơ̆ng pơma lơ jing kơtul.

English: When you make a vow to God, do not delay to pay it; For He has no pleasure in fools. Pay what you have vowed
Bahnar: Tơdah ih đei pơma pơkă hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei athei jah pơm pơkeh nơ̆r pơkă noh; yua kơ lu bơngai kơtul ưh kơ đei pơm kơ Kră Yang lăp đon. Lei jah pơkeh nơ̆r ih pơkă noh.

English: Better not to vow than to vow and not pay.
Bahnar: Kơtrơ̆m 'nĕ pơkă, 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ pơkă mă ưh kơ pơm.

English: Do not let your mouth cause your flesh to sin, nor say before the messenger of God that it was an error. Why should God be angry at your excuse and destroy the work of your hands?
Bahnar: 'Nĕ ăn kơ 'bơ̆r ih pơm kơ akâu ih yoch na athei năm khan kơ 'bok soi, inh pơkă 'bơm glăi boih. Liơ ih pơm kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua kơ đơ̆ng nơ̆r ih pơkă, na mah Kră Yang pơrăm lê̆ đĭ tơdrong đêl ti ih pơm!

English: For in the multitude of dreams and many words there is also vanity. But fear God.
Bahnar: Tơ yơ đei tơdrong apo lơ păng pơma lơ hnang, 'noh kư̆m tơdrong kơ đei; mă-lei ih athei hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: If you see the oppression of the poor, and the violent perversion of justice and righteousness in a province, do not marvel at the matter; for high official watches over high official, and higher officials are over them.
Bahnar: Dah ih 'bôh lăm tơring ih đei bơngai mă đe pơjuă pơđep sư dah 'bôh pơm ưh kơ trŏ, ưh kơ tơpăt hơnơ̆ng, lei ih 'nĕ kơ chrêu kơ đon; yua kơ đei bơngai pơm tih kư̆m đei bơngai tih hloh kơ sư oei răp lăng, đơ̆ng noh oei đei 'bok mă tih hloh đĭ kơ bre noh dơ̆ng.

English: Moreover the profit of the land is for all; even the king is served from the field.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei juăt kơ choh jang chŭn mir, kăl kơ đei pơtao 'lơ̆ng pơgơ̆r na teh đak sư gơh đei yua tôm tơdrong.

English: He who loves silver will not be satisfied with silver; Nor he who loves abundance, with increase. This also is vanity.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai ham kơ jên đei jên lơ kư̆m khan ưh kơmah; lu bơngai ham kơ mŭk tơmam đei lơ dôm yơ kư̆m ưh kơ hrăp. Tơdrong noh kư̆m tơdrong kơ đei.

English: When goods increase, They increase who eat them; So what profit have the owners Except to see them with their eyes?
Bahnar: Dah đei mŭk tơmam rai lơ dang yơ, bơngai sa kư̆m rai lơ dang noh mơ̆n. Tơ'ngla đei mŭk tơmam noh hăm đei lơi yua kiơ kơ sư. Măt sư kư̆ hrăn pơglăn tơ mŭk tơmam noh.

English: The sleep of a laboring man is sweet, Whether he eats little or much; But the abundance of the rich will not permit him to sleep.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai jang gleh hrat, mă sŏng sa tŏ sĕt dah lơ tep hiôk kơmăng; mă-lei lu bơngai mơdrŏng, đei sa rơkah rơkai, mă-lei tep ưh kơ hiôk.

English: There is a severe evil which I have seen under the sun: Riches kept for their owner to his hurt.
Bahnar: Đei minh tơdrong kơnê̆ dêh mă inh 'bôh tơ ala teh âu: Bơngai mơdrŏng mong mŭk tơmam ưh kơ hơđơ̆ng hiôk.

English: But those riches perish through misfortune; When he begets a son, there is nothing in his hand.
Bahnar: Dah đei tơdrong răm truh, dôm lu mŭk tơmam 'nâu hiong đĭ; sư đei kon hơ'lơ̆p, mă-lei pă đei ăn kơ kon sư kiơ.

English: As he came from his mother’s womb, naked shall he return, To go as he came; And he shall take nothing from his labor Which he may carry away in his hand.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n lĕch đơ̆ng klak mĕ akâu hoh, bơ̆n lôch brŏk tơ teh kư̆m hoh thoi noh mơ̆n, brŏk tơpang ti hoh ưh kơ đei chĕp ba kiơ đơ̆ng tơdrong jang mă gleh hrat noh.

English: And this also is a severe evil— Just exactly as he came, so shall he go. And what profit has he who has labored for the wind?
Bahnar: 'Nâu kư̆m minh tơdrong kơnê̆ dêh tơpă. Bơ̆n lĕch đơ̆ng klak mĕ thoi yơ kư̆m gô brŏk tơ teh thoi 'noh mơ̆n. Lu bơngai mă jang gleh hrat wă hiong ngôi mơ̆ng kơ kial bơbơ̆t, hăm đei lơi yua kiơ ưh?

English: All his days he also eats in darkness, And he has much sorrow and sickness and anger.
Bahnar: Ih sa rai oei arih tơ lăm măng mu, đei lơ tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon chhŭr nuih, gleh lap, jĭ jăn.

English: Here is what I have seen: It is good and fitting for one to eat and drink, and to enjoy the good of all his labor in which he toils under the sun all the days of his life which God gives him; for it is his heritage.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh tơdrong mă 'lơ̆ng kơ kon bơngai noh sŏng sa păng hiôk chơt lăm tơdrong jang gleh hrat tơ ala teh mă bơ̆n đei pơm noh, đĭ khei sơnăm lăm chăl arih âu mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei ăn boih, noh tơdrong mă đei 'măn lê̆ kơ bơ̆n.

English: As for every man to whom God has given riches and wealth, and given him power to eat of it, to receive his heritage and rejoice in his labor—this is the gift of God.
Bahnar: Hloh kơ noh dơ̆ng bơngai bu Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư mơdrŏng, đei mŭk tơmam lơ sư gơh yua gơh iŏk tơmam noh păng hiôk chơt lăm tơdrong jang sư mă hrat gleh noh boih tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei asong ăn.

English: For he will not dwell unduly on the days of his life, because God keeps him busy with the joy of his heart.
Bahnar: Sư noh gô hiơt pă 'blŏk bơih dôm lu năr gleh hrat, ơh sơ'ngon lăm chăl arih sư mă đĭ hlôi bơih, yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lăm jơhngơ̆m sư đei tơdrong hiôk chơt.

English: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, and it is common among men
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh dơ̆ng đei minh tơdrong kơnê̆ lăm ala teh âu, tơdrong mă pơm kơ kon bơngai trăp trĭn dêh.

English: A man to whom God has given riches and wealth and honor, so that he lacks nothing for himself of all he desires; yet God does not give him power to eat of it, but a foreigner consumes it. This is vanity, and it is an evil affliction.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư mơdrŏng, đei mŭk tơmam lơ, đe ư-ang, dĭng mah dôm tơdrong jơhngơ̆m sư hơpơi nă đei ngăl, ưh kơ đei kơ'bah kiơ hloi; mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ ăn sư yua sa mŭk tơmam sư noh ôh, tă kơ bơngai nai đei yua sa mŭk tơmam sư noh. Noh jơ̆ tơdrong kơđei, noh boih tơdrong tơnat kơhlôh dêh.

English: If a man begets a hundred children and lives many years, so that the days of his years are many, but his soul is not satisfied with goodness, or indeed he has no burial, I say that a stillborn child is better than he
Bahnar: Dah minh 'nu bơngai pơjing đei minh-hrĕng 'nu kon hơ'lơ̆p păng sư arih sot đunh sơnăm, mă-lei lăm jơhngơ̆m sư 'nhŏ mă đei tơdrong hiôk chơt păng sư lôch ưh kơ đei bơngai 'bŭ; Inh khan kon nge rơngăt sư oei păi 'biơ̆ kơ bơngai noh 'mơ̆i.

English: for it comes in vanity and departs in darkness, and its name is covered with darkness.
Bahnar: Yua kơ kon nge rơngăt noh lĕch đơ̆ng klak mĕ sư, đơ̆ng noh sư năm tơ anih măng mu, đe 'bŭ sư lăm teh.

English: Though it has not seen the sun or known anything, this has more rest than that man
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ tam 'bôh măt 'năr, kư̆m ưh kơ tam băt kiơ; sư năm pơdơh hiôk hloh kơ bơngai kră noh.

English: even if he lives a thousand years twice—but has not seen goodness. Do not all go to one place?
Bahnar: Mă khan bơngai bu arih sot kră truh tơ 'bar-rơbâu sơnăm mă-lei ưh kơ đei arih hiôk chơt lăm chăl arih âu. Kŭm ưh kơ đei hiôk dang nge lôch rơngăt. Hăm trŏ kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai tă kơ wă brŏk tơ minh anih đĕch?

English: All the labor of man is for his mouth, And yet the soul is not satisfied.
Bahnar: Kon bơngai nŏng kơ adrin jang gleh hrat noh yua kơ wă 'me hơlŏng klak ao hrŭk, mă-lei jơhngơ̆m 'maih wă ưh kơ đei layơ hrăp.

English: For what more has the wise man than the fool? What does the poor man have, Who knows how to walk before the living?
Bahnar: Bơngai hơgei đei yua kiơ hloh kơ bơngai kơtul bơngai dơnuh băt đei đon arih sa 'lơ̆ng hăm đei yua kiơ ưh?

English: Better is the sight of the eyes than the wandering of desire. This also is vanity and grasping for the wind.
Bahnar: Tơdrong kiơ măt 'bôh sư 'lơ̆ng, sư hloh kơ chă hơpơi rŏ. Noh kư̆m tơdrong kơđei.

English: Whatever one is, he has been named already, For it is known that he is man; And he cannot contend with Him who is mightier than he.
Bahnar: Tơmam kiơ mă đei dang ei sư đĭ đei anăn boih. Bơ̆n kư̆m băt kơ kon bơngai gô thoi yơ; kon bơngai ưh kơ gơh pơjah plơ̆ hăm tơ'ngla mă pran kơtang hloh kơ bơ̆n.

English: Since there are many things that increase vanity, How is man the better?
Bahnar: Rai đei tơdrong pơma lơ rai tơdrong kơđei hăm đei tơdrong kiơ lơi yua 'biơ̆ kơ kon bơngai ưh?

English: For who knows what is good for man in life, all the days of his vain life which he passes like a shadow? Who can tell a man what will happen after him under the sun?
Bahnar: Yua kơ dôm lu năr lăm chăl arih kon bơngai ưh kơ yua kiơ păr hiong thoi yơ̆p thoi ngôi, hăm đei bu băt tơdrong kiơ 'lơ̆ng đei lơi yua kơ bơ̆n? Hăm đei bơngai bu gơh khan lê̆ adrol tơdrong kiơ wă truh kơ bơngai 'nâu, đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sư lôch?

English: A good name is better than precious ointment, And the day of death than the day of one’s birth
Bahnar: Anăn đe ư-ang 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ đak pơgang 'bâu phu mă gĭt; năr lôch 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ năr hơiơch.

English: Better to go to the house of mourning Than to go to the house of feasting, For that is the end of all men; And the living will take it to heart.
Bahnar: Năm tơ hnam đe lôch, 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ năm tơ hnam đe et sa tih; yua kơ lei bơngai arih athei 'blŏk dah đei jơ wă tơchĕng kơ tơdrong noh.

English: Sorrow is better than laughter, For by a sad countenance the heart is made better.
Bahnar: Ơh sơ'ngon 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ hiĕk chơt, yua kơ đơ̆ng sơ'ngon pơih kơ̆l 'ngok hơdah.

English: The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning, But the heart of fools is in the house of mirth.
Bahnar: Bơngai hơgei ling-lang tơchĕng kơ tơdrong lôch, bơngai kơtul nŏng kơ tơchĕng kơ tơdrong hiôk chơt đĕch.

English: It is better to hear the rebuke of the wise Than for a man to hear the song of fools.
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu bơngai hơgei hil bơtho. Sư 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r bơngai kơtul hơri chơt.

English: For like the crackling of thorns under a pot, So is the laughter of the fool. This also is vanity.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r hiĕk lu bơngai kơtul re nhen ŭnh sa bơmreh jơla đe tơkuh ala gŏ. Re mơ̆ng tơdrong kơ đei.

English: Surely oppression destroys a wise man’s reason, And a bribe debases the heart.
Bahnar: Mưh pơjuă pơđep đe pơm kơ lu bơngai hơgei jing kơtul păng sa pơgâm sư pơm kơ kơ̆l 'ngok măng mu.

English: The end of a thing is better than its beginning; The patient in spirit is better than the proud in spirit.
Bahnar: Pơkeh ming tơdrong jang 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ 'nao pơtơm pơm plơ̆ng, chơ̆n jơhngơ̆m 'lơ̆ng hloh 'bônh kơ pơang.

English: Do not hasten in your spirit to be angry, For anger rests in the bosom of fools.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ hăt kơ hil, yua đơ̆ng tơdrong hơgei na gơh wei tơdrong arih kơdih akâu.

English: Do not say, “Why were the former days better than these?” For you do not inquire wisely concerning this.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ jet: “Yua kơ kiơ chăl adrol sơ̆ 'lơ̆ng 'biơ̆ kơ chăl ahrei?” Yua kơ apinh thoi noh ưh kơ hơgei ôh.

English: Wisdom is good with an inheritance, And profitable to those who see the sun.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hơgei gĭt kăl nhen thoi bơngai đei tơmam chŭn mir ioi đơ̆ng adrĕch sư, păng chĕp ba tơdrong đei yua đunh sơnăm kơ lơ bơngai lăm chăl arih.

English: For wisdom is a defense as money is a defense, But the excellence of knowledge is that wisdom gives life to those who have it.
Bahnar: Kŭm nhen thoi jên kăk, tơdrong hơgei nhen thoi ngôi pĕng akâu jăn, mă-lei tơdrong hlôh băt kơ bơngai hơgei đei yua đunh sơnăm hloh, yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong hơgei na gơh wei tơdrong arih lu bơ̆n.

English: Consider the work of God; For who can make straight what He has made crooked?
Bahnar: Lăng bĕ tơdrong jang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Tơmam kiơ sư gŭt pơđŏng yŏng kiơ kĕ 'bơ̆ tơpăt.

English: In the day of prosperity be joyful, But in the day of adversity consider: Surely God has appointed the one as well as the other, So that man can find out nothing that will come after him.
Bahnar: Lăm năr hiôk athei chơt, lăm năr pơmat-tat, lăng bĕ. Pŭn hiôk dah pơmat-tat. 'Bar tơdrong noh đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn.

English: I have seen everything in my days of vanity: There is a just man who perishes in his righteousness, And there is a wicked man who prolongs life in his wickedness.
Bahnar: Đĭ lăm chăl arih tơdrong ưh kơđei, inh hlôi 'bôh băt boih kơ đĭ-đăng tơdrong 'nâu. Đei bơngai pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt tă kơ lôch 'bônh; bơngai pơm kơnê̆, tă kơ lê̆ arih sot.

English: Do not be overly righteous, Nor be overly wise: Why should you destroy yourself?
Bahnar: 'Nĕ gan pơrŏ dêh khan bơ̆n bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, kư̆m 'nĕ khan kơ bơ̆n bơngai hơgei hloh. Đei yua kiơ rai pơrăm kơdih akâu.

English: Do not be overly wicked, Nor be foolish: Why should you die before your time?
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kiơ̆ lu trong pơm kơnê̆ păng 'nĕ kơ oei sa thoi bơngai kơtul bơlŭk; đei yua kiơ rai jah lôch adrol kơ jơ 'năr hơgăt.

English: It is good that you grasp this, And also not remove your hand from the other; For he who fears God will escape them all.
Bahnar: 'Lơ̆ng hloh kơ ih athei 'nĕ kơ pơư kơdih akâu 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, gơh hơgei păng athei areh kơ tơdrong kơnê̆. Yua kơ bơngai bu hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư gơh weh đơ̆ng 'bar tơdrong noh.

English: Wisdom strengthens the wise More than ten rulers of the city.
Bahnar: Bơngai hơgei gơh đei jơhngơ̆m pran hloh kơ mơjĭt 'nu bơngai pơgơ̆r lăm pơlei tih.

English: For there is not a just man on earth who does good And does not sin.
Bahnar: Tơpă, lăm teh đak âu ưh kơ đei minh 'nu tơpăt, pơm 'lơ̆ng ling-lang ưh kơlah pơm yoch.

English: Also do not take to heart everything people say, Lest you hear your servant cursing you.
Bahnar: Thoi ei 'nĕ kơ mơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r đe pơma, kơnh ih kơtơ̆ng 'bơ̆r đĭch đam ih blei hiap ih.

English: For many times, also, your own heart has known That even you have cursed others.
Bahnar: Lăm jơhngơ̆m ih kư̆m băt boih. Đei lơ wơ̆t ih kư̆m đei hiap lơ bơngai.

English: All this I have proved by wisdom. I said, “I will be wise”; But it was far from me.
Bahnar: Inh hlôi pơlong lăng boih tơdrong hơgei inh, inh khan: Inh bơngai gơh hơgei; mă-lei tơdrong hơgei oei ataih dêh kơ inh.

English: As for that which is far off and exceedingly deep, Who can find it out?
Bahnar: Dôm, tơdrong hơgei tă kơ ataih jrŭ dêh, kơ̆l 'ngok kon bơngai.

English: I applied my heart to know, To search and seek out wisdom and the reason of things, To know the wickedness of folly, Even of foolishness and madness.
Bahnar: Inh adrin chơchă đĭ jơhngơ̆m wă kơ băt, hơlen wă kơ 'bôh tơdrong hơgei, wă kơ gơh tơlang tôm tơdrong, inh đei 'bôh tơdrong kơnê̆ noh lĕch đơ̆ng tơdrong kơtul kơwao na jing wơnh.

English: And I find more bitter than death The woman whose heart is snares and nets, Whose hands are fetters. He who pleases God shall escape from her, But the sinner shall be trapped by her.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh drŏ-kăn 'bĕnh tơdrong pơhlŭ sơ'ngon trăp hloh kơ tơdrong lôch. Tơdrong hưch sư thoi hơnhuăl, ti sư thoi tơlei glang. Bơngai bu băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh klaih đơ̆ng ti sư. Mă-lei bơngai bu pơm yoch, sư 'leh lăm hơnhuăl noh.

English: Here is what I have found,” says the Preacher, “Adding one thing to the other to find out the reason
Bahnar: 'Bok bơtho khan: “Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ tơchĕng lăng rim tơdrong, wă kơ chă tơdrong tơlang trŏ, lei 'nâu mă tơdrong inh chă 'bôh

English: Which my soul still seeks but I cannot find: One man among a thousand I have found, But a woman among all these I have not found.
Bahnar: Noh boih jơ̆ tơdrong inh oei wă chơchă ling-lang mă ưh tam 'bôh: Lăm minh-rơbâu 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo, inh chă 'bôh boih lăp minh 'nu đĕch bơngai tơpăt; na lăm đĭ-đăng lu bơngai drŏ-kăn, inh chă ưh kơ đei minh 'nu bu hloi tơpăt.

English: Truly, this only I have found: That God made man upright, But they have sought out many schemes.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'nâu mă tơdrong inh chă 'bôh: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing boih bơngai tơpăt; mă-lei kon bơngai chơchă đon kơdih tơdrong kơnê̆.”

English: Who is like a wise man? And who knows the interpretation of a thing? A man’s wisdom makes his face shine, And the sternness of his face is changed.
Bahnar: Bu kiơ̆ tam lu bơngai hơgei? Bu gơh tơblang dôm tơdrong dôm tơmam? Tơdrong hơgei pơm kơ măt kon bơngai hơdah hơdong, đêl muh măt ưh kơ praih, tơplih jing praih.

English: I say, “Keep the king’s commandment for the sake of your oath to God.
Bahnar: Chu yom bĕ kơ nơ̆r pơtao pơkă, yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, pơkă wă wei-lăng pơtao.

English: Do not be hasty to go from his presence. Do not take your stand for an evil thing, for he does whatever pleases him.”
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hăt kơdŭn weh đơ̆ng anăp pơtao. 'Nĕ kơ pơgơ̆p hăm tơdrong kơnê̆, yua kơ pơm kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong thoi sư wă.

English: Where the word of a king is, there is power; And who may say to him, “What are you doing?”
Bahnar: Mă loi, nơ̆r pơtao pơma đei tơdrong gơh kĕ; hăm đei bu pơ̆n pơma plơ̆ kơ sư khan: Ih pơm kiơ?

English: He who keeps his command will experience nothing harmful; And a wise man’s heart discerns both time and judgment
Bahnar: Bơngai bu chu pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r pơtao wơh, lei bơngai noh ưh kơ đei layơ tơ'bơ̆p tơdrong kơnê̆ ôh păng lu bơngai hơgei băt kơ jơ 'năr păng băt kơ tơdrong kăl kơ pơm.

English: Because for every matter there is a time and judgment, Though the misery of man increases greatly.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đĭ-đăng đei tơdrong hơnat păng rŭng răng lăp kơ jơ 'năr păng đei tơdrong ngăl.

English: For he does not know what will happen; So who can tell him when it will occur?
Bahnar: Yua kơ kon bơngai ưh kơ đei bu băt adrol tơdrong kiơ wă truh; lei na ưh kơ đei bu gơh khan lê̆ adrol kơ năr dơning sư thoi yơ?

English: No one has power over the spirit to retain the spirit, And no one has power in the day of death. There is no release from that war, And wickedness will not deliver those who are given to it.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu gơh chĕp pơgơ̆r tơdrong arih; kư̆m ưh kơ đei bu gơh weh kơ lôch; lăm tơdrong tơblah tơdrong lôch ưh kơ đei lê̆ bu; bu pơm kơnê̆, tơdrong kơnê̆ kư̆m ưh kơ gơh dŏng pơklaih sư đơ̆ng tơdrong lôch ôh.

English: All this I have seen, and applied my heart to every work that is done under the sun: There is a time in which one man rules over another to his own hurt.
Bahnar: Inh chă lăng hơlen tôm tơdrong đei pơm ala teh âu, inh 'bôh lu bơngai pơgơ̆r ngăl pơjuă pơđep đe.

English: Then I saw the wicked buried, who had come and gone from the place of holiness, and they were forgotten in the city where they had so done. This also is vanity.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m đei 'bôh lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ lôch, đei kon pơlei 'bŭ hơmet pơ'lơ̆ng; yua kơ sư juăt kơ năm tơ hnam akŭm. Na lu bơngai pơm 'lơ̆ng, oei kơtă lăm pơlei tih đe 'bônh kơ hiơt, noh kư̆m jơ̆ tơdrong kơ đei.

English: Because the sentence against an evil work is not executed speedily, therefore the heart of the sons of men is fully set in them to do evil.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu bơngai mă pơm kơnê̆ ră, đe ưh kơ đei phak hloi, lei na jơhngơ̆m kon bơngai oei 'maih pơm kơnê̆ dêh.

English: Though a sinner does evil a hundred times, and his days are prolonged, yet I surely know that it will be well with those who fear God, who fear before Him.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu bơngai mă pơm kơnê̆ hơdôm hrĕng wơ̆t, kư̆m oei arih sot; lei ră inh băt lu bơngai hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, sĭt gô đei tơdrong pŭn hiôk yua lu sư hli yom Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: But it will not be well with the wicked; nor will he prolong his days, which are as a shadow, because he does not fear before God.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơnê̆, ưh kơ đei pŭn hiôk ôh; kư̆m ưh kơ arih sot mơ̆n, yua kơ chăl arih lu sư nhen thoi yơ̆p, thoi ngôi 'bônh kơ păr hiong; yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: There is a vanity which occurs on earth, that there are just men to whom it happens according to the work of the wicked; again, there are wicked men to whom it happens according to the work of the righteous. I said that this also is vanity.
Bahnar: Oei đei minh tơdrong lăm ala teh âu kư̆m tơdrong kơđei. Lơ bơngai pơm 'lơ̆ng tă kơ đe pơm kơnê̆ kơ sư nhen thoi lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ păng đei lơ bơngai pơm kơnê̆ tă huay pơm kơnê̆ kơ sư thoi lu bơngai pơm 'lơ̆ng. Inh khan tơdrong noh kư̆m tơdrong kơđei.

English: So I commended enjoyment, because a man has nothing better under the sun than to eat, drink, and be merry; for this will remain with him in his labor all the days of his life which God gives him under the sun.
Bahnar: Inh pơư hloi tơdrong hiôk chơt noh 'lơ̆ng, yua kơ lăm ala teh 'nâu ưh kơ đei tơdrong kiơ 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ kon bơngai bơ̆n sŏng sa, nhă đak păng hiôk chơt; noh boih tơdrong mă apah 'mong ăn kơtơ̆ng tơdrong bơ̆n bơ̆jang arih gleh hrat, đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei ăn kơ bơ̆n tơ ala teh âu.

English: When I applied my heart to know wisdom and to see the business that is done on earth, even though one sees no sleep day or night
Bahnar: Kơplah jơhngơ̆m inh adrin nŏng kơ tơchĕng chơchă wă kơ băt tơdrong gơh hơgei, măng năr măt pă đei pơdơh. Tơchĕng liơ tơdrong jang mă gleh hrat pơmat-tat dêh lăm teh đak âu.

English: then I saw all the work of God, that a man cannot find out the work that is done under the sun. For though a man labors to discover it, yet he will not find it; moreover, though a wise man attempts to know it, he will not be able to find it.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m 'bôh tôm tơdrong jang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, inh băt kon bơngai ưh kơ kĕ hlôh đĭ kơ dôm tơdrong đei truh tơ ala teh âu, mă khan nŏng hĭ tôch bơneh kư̆m ưh kơ kĕ hlôh kiơ; păng mă khan bơngai hơgei ngeh khan gô băt, kư̆m ưh kơ kĕ kơ băt 'mơ̆i.

English: For I considered all this in my heart, so that I could declare it all: that the righteous and the wise and their works are in the hand of God. People know neither love nor hatred by anything they see before them.
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong mă inh oei tơchĕng. Lu bơngai pơm 'lơ̆ng tơdrong hơgei păng tơdrong lu sư pơm, đĭ-đăng oei lăm tơpang ti Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ngăl; sư 'mêm kơ bu, areh kơ bu, kon bơngai ưh kơ đei bu băt ôh: Đĭ-đăng tơdrong noh, tơdrong tơ anăp kơnh ngăl.

English: All things come alike to all: One event happens to the righteous and the wicked; To the good, the clean, and the unclean; To him who sacrifices and him who does not sacrifice. As is the good, so is the sinner; He who takes an oath as he who fears an oath.
Bahnar: Tôm tơdrong đei hơgăt kơ kon bơngai lei-lăi băl ngăl: Bơngai pơm 'lơ̆ng dah bơngai pơm kơnê̆, bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh dah bơngai 'mê̆-'mach, bơngai pơyơ̆r tơmam soi dah bơngai ưh kơ pơyơ̆r, bơngai 'lơ̆ng dah bơngai pơm yoch, bơngai đei nơ̆r pơkăm pơkă dah bơngai hli kơ nơ̆r pơkă, đĭ-đăng đei iŏk hơdai minh tơdrong đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei 'măn lê̆ boih.

English: This is an evil in all that is done under the sun: that one thing happens to all. Truly the hearts of the sons of men are full of evil; madness is in their hearts while they live, and after that they go to the dead.
Bahnar: Tơdrong mă sơ'ngon dêh lăm ala teh âu, đĭ-đăng bơngai tă kơ lei-lăi ngăl. Mă loi lu bơngai đei, jơhngơ̆m 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ păng kơplah lu sư oei arih ưh kơ băt tơchĕng, kiơ̆ kơtul kơwao tuch-luch đĭ-đăng gô lôch ngăl.

English: But for him who is joined to all the living there is hope, for a living dog is better than a dead lion.
Bahnar: Kơbĭ bu gơh klaih đơ̆ng noh? Arih oei đei hơmĕng; yua kơ minh pôm kon kŏ oei arih sư hloh kơ minh pôm Dăm-brang lôch.

English: For the living know that they will die; But the dead know nothing, And they have no more reward, For the memory of them is forgotten.
Bahnar: Bơngai arih sư băt kơdih sư gô lôch; mă-lei bơngai lôch ưh pă băt kiơ boih, kư̆m ưh kơ đei tơmam apah bơnê kiơ mơ̆n, yua kơ đe gô hiơt ưh pă đei bu 'blŏk kơ lu sư dơ̆ng.

English: Also their love, their hatred, and their envy have now perished; Nevermore will they have a share In anything done under the sun.
Bahnar: Mă đĭ kơ tơdrong 'mêm, tơdrong areh, tơdrong pơjah tơgar, đĭ-đăng kư̆m gô hiong hiach đĭ; lu sư kư̆m pă đei kiơ lăm dôm tơdrong jang lăm ala teh âu.

English: Go, eat your bread with joy, And drink your wine with a merry heart; For God has already accepted your works.
Bahnar: Lei sŏng sa hiôk hal bĕ păng huch đak hơmu ih mă chơt hiôk bĕ! Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn boih kơ inh dôm tơdrong noh.

English: Let your garments always be white, And let your head lack no oil.
Bahnar: Mă layơ ih kư̆m athei hrŭk hơbĕn ao kok 'nao ling-lang thoi năr et sa tih păng 'nĕ hiơt pik pơgang 'bâu phu kơpal kơ̆l ih.

English: Live joyfully with the wife whom you love all the days of your vain life which He has given you under the sun, all your days of vanity; for that is your portion in life, and in the labor which you perform under the sun.
Bahnar: Dôm lu năr lăm chăl arih ih mă ưh kơ yua Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn boih kơ ih lăm ala teh 'nâu, ih athei oei sa mă hiôk chơt bĕ hăm kon akăn ih mă ih 'mêm kơeng; yua kơ noh jơ̆ tơdrong apah kơ ih đơ̆ng tơdrong gleh hrat.

English: Whatever your hand finds to do, do it with your might; for there is no work or device or knowledge or wisdom in the grave where you are going.
Bahnar: Mă dôm kiơ ih gơh pơm jang bĕ đĭ jơhngơ̆m tôch kơ ih kĕ; yua kơ tơ anih lôch mă ih wă năm, tơ noh ưh pă đei minh tơdrong jang, kiơ mă ih gơh pơm, mă chă đon mă gơh hơgei, mă kơ̆l 'ngok, hlôh băt.

English: I returned and saw under the sun that— The race is not to the swift, Nor the battle to the strong, Nor bread to the wise, Nor riches to men of understanding, Nor favor to men of skill; But time and chance happen to them all.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh dơ̆ng đei tơ lăm ala teh 'nâu. Bơngai kơdâu hrĕnh kư̆m ưh kơ jei sư ling-lang lăm năr kơdâu pơjei, bơngai pran kư̆m ưh kơ kĕ tơblah jei ngăl, bơngai hơgei kư̆m ưh kơ đei tơmam sa phĭ mah ngăl, bơngai hlôh wao kư̆m ưh kơ mơdrŏng ngăl, bơngai đei 'bơ̆r đon kư̆m ưh kơ đei pŭn hiôk, yua kơ jơ lăp gô truh kơ đĭ-đăng rim bơngai lei-lăi.

English: For man also does not know his time: Like fish taken in a cruel net, Like birds caught in a snare, So the sons of men are snared in an evil time, When it falls suddenly upon them.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu băt ôh layơ sư lôch thoi ka đom lăm hơnhuăl, thoi sem 'leh hơđong, kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n, kon bơngai bơ̆n đom lăm năr tơdrong truh, 'bôh 'băi truh hloi ưh kơ tam băt.

English: This wisdom I have also seen under the sun, and it seemed great to me
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m đei 'bôh lăm ala teh âu, Thoi tơdrong hơgei 'bôh sư hơgrih 'biơ̆.

English: There was a little city with few men in it; and a great king came against it, besieged it, and built great snares around it.
Bahnar: Đei minh pôm pơlei iĕ, bơngai oei tŏ sĕt đĕch, đei minh 'nu pơtao mơdrŏng pran kơtang năm wă wang blah pơlei noh.

English: Now there was found in it a poor wise man, and he by his wisdom delivered the city. Yet no one remembered that same poor man.
Bahnar: Lăm pơlei đei minh 'nu bơngai dơnuh hin mă-lei hơgei, sư yua tơdrong hơgei sư pơklaih pơlei noh; mă-lei đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'noh ưh kơ đei bu 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ bơngai dơnuh hin.

English: Then I said: “Wisdom is better than strength. Nevertheless the poor man’s wisdom is despised, And his words are not heard.
Bahnar: Inh khan bơngai hơgei hloh kơ tơdrong kơtang. Mă-lei tơdrong hơgei bơngai dơnuh hin đe pơjăm. Păng sư pơma ưh kơ đei bu wă mơ̆ng.

English: Words of the wise, spoken quietly, should be heard Rather than the shout of a ruler of fools.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r bơngai hơgei pơma đei pơyom hloh kơ nơ̆r bơngai pơm yŏng kơtul ôr hơdrăi.

English: Wisdom is better than weapons of war; But one sinner destroys much good.”
Bahnar: Tơdrong hơgei đei pran hloh kơ đao hơlă, mă-lei lăp minh 'nu bơngai đĕch pơm glăi đĕch, sư pơrăm đĭ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng.

English: Dead flies putrefy the perfumer’s ointment, And cause it to give off a foul odor; So does a little folly to one respected for wisdom and honor.
Bahnar: Minh pôm roi lôch pơm kơ đak 'bâu phu jing 'bâu ôm; wơnh 'bơm tŏ sĕt đĕch pơm ăn kơ anăn bơngai hơgei đe ưh pă ư-ang.

English: A wise man’s heart is at his right hand, But a fool’s heart at his left.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m bơngai hơgei đei ba sư tơdrong trŏ; na jơhngơ̆m bơngai kơtul pơdrŭt sư pơm tơdrong glăi.

English: Even when a fool walks along the way, He lacks wisdom, And he shows everyone that he is a fool.
Bahnar: Truh tơ yak rok trong tih bơngai kơtul nơnăm kư̆m ưh kơ wao; tơ'bôh ăn kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai băt sư bơngai kơtul.

English: If the spirit of the ruler rises against you, Do not leave your post; For conciliation pacifies great offenses.
Bahnar: Dah yŏng pơgơ̆r hil, ih 'nĕ hăt kơdâu weh đơ̆ng anih ih, yua kơ đơ̆ng ih chu sư na gơh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong glăi tih.

English: There is an evil I have seen under the sun, As an error proceeding from the ruler
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh minh tơdrong glăi tih lăm ala teh âu. Tơdrong pơm glăi đơ̆ng lu bơngai pơgơ̆r

English: Folly is set in great dignity, While the rich sit in a lowly place.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơtul bơlŭk, đe pôk hơtŏk sư jang tơdrong tih, lu bơngai mơdrŏng tơdrong hơgei tă oei tơ ala.

English: I have seen servants on horses, While princes walk on the ground like servants.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m 'bôh bơngai đĭch hao aseh, na yŏng tơ'ngla sư tă nơnăm jơ̆ng hoh nhen thoi bơngai đĭch.

English: He who digs a pit will fall into it, And whoever breaks through a wall will be bitten by a serpent.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu sir sơlŭng phŏ gô puh huŏng lăm sơlŭng, na bơngai bu yuih tơnăr hnam, phŏ 'bih gô choh sư.

English: He who quarries stones may be hurt by them, And he who splits wood may be endangered by it.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu teh tơmo, phŏ tơmo gô kơtĭt sư jĭ; bơngai blah 'long ŭnh, phŏ phŏ gô prâu 'bơm sư jĭ rơka.

English: If the ax is dull, And one does not sharpen the edge, Then he must use more strength; But wisdom brings success.
Bahnar: Pla sung kơmŭl ưh kơ pat măt sư, gô huach hiong jơhngơ̆m lơ; mă-lei tơdrong hơgei gô tơgŭm keh đang.

English: A serpent may bite when it is not charmed; The babbler is no different.
Bahnar: Tơdah 'bih choh adrol kơ krao bơngai pơm kơ 'bih 'beh, lei chă bơngai pơm kơ 'bih noh 'beh pă yua kiơ boih.

English: The words of a wise man’s mouth are gracious, But the lips of a fool shall swallow him up
Bahnar: Nơ̆r bơngai hơgei pơma pơm ăn kơ đe pơyom; mă-lei nơ̆r bơngai kơtul pơma ba tơdrong răm kơdih akâu.

English: The words of his mouth begin with foolishness, And the end of his talk is raving madness.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r sư pơma, blŭng-a jơ̆ kơtul, tuch-luch sư kơtul răm rai dêh.

English: A fool also multiplies words. No man knows what is to be; Who can tell him what will be after him?
Bahnar: Bơngai kơtul kơwao juăt kơ pơma lơ, pơma chơgăm; mă-lei, kon bơngai ưh kơ đei bu băt ôh tơdrong kiơ gô truh păng ưh kơ đei bu băt lê̆ adrol tơdrong kiơ gô truh kơ sư đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lôch.

English: The labor of fools wearies them, For they do not even know how to go to the city!
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơtul jang, pơgleh lu sư kơdih, yua kơ lu sư mah ưh pă băt wă brŏk trong ayơ wă gơh truh tơ pơlei.

English: Woe to you, O land, when your king is a child, And your princes feast in the morning!
Bahnar: Răm-'băm tơpă kơ dêh char ayơ đei pơtao oei 'lơ̆p păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r hăt kơ et sa pơrŏ đơ̆ng pơgê hrôih.

English: Blessed are you, O land, when your king is the son of nobles, And your princes feast at the proper time— For strength and not for drunkenness!
Bahnar: Pŭn hiôk dêh kơ teh đak đei pơtao adrĕch yŏng mơng păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r băt sŏng sa trŏ kơ jơ, wă tơgŭm jơhngơ̆m pran, ưh kơ sĭ et wă kơ suai.

English: Because of laziness the building decays, And through idleness of hands the house leaks.
Bahnar: Kơlih yua kơ đơ̆ng nơng hơlah kơ jang na anih ưh kơ gram hnam ưh kơ hơnĭl.

English: A feast is made for laughter, And wine makes merry; But money answers everything.
Bahnar: Đe pơih et sa wă kơ chơt hiôk; et tơdrô pơthim ăn kơ chăl arih chơt; đei jên kăk gơh răt tôm tơdrong.

English: Do not curse the king, even in your thought; Do not curse the rich, even in your bedroom; For a bird of the air may carry your voice, And a bird in flight may tell the matter.
Bahnar: Mă khan lăm tơdrong ih tơchĕng, ih 'nĕ kơ hiap pơtê̆ pơtao ôh; mă khan lăm anih ih tep, ih kư̆m 'nĕ kơ hiap lu bơngai mơdrŏng mơng; yua kơ lu sem păr anhăk pơđông roi tơdrong ih pơm tơ ataih.

English: Cast your bread upon the waters, For you will find it after many days.
Bahnar: Gơih bĕ mŭk tơmam ih tơ kơpal đak, na ning-mônh kơnh ih gô đei sư dơ̆ng.

English: Give a serving to seven, and also to eight, For you do not know what evil will be on the earth.
Bahnar: Ih athei chă asong kơ tơpơh 'nu, tơhngam 'nu, truh tơ lơ bơngai, yua ưh kơ băt năr ayơ gô đei tơdrong truh kơ ih.

English: If the clouds are full of rain, They empty themselves upon the earth; And if a tree falls to the south or the north, In the place where the tree falls, there it shall lie.
Bahnar: Mưh đei hơmơ̆l găm noh wă đei 'mi jur; mưh 'long păk tơ gah gơal dah păk tơ gah yă-nơ̆m, mă păk 'bơ̆t yơ, 'bơ̆t yơ sư oei 'bơ̆t dei.

English: He who observes the wind will not sow, And he who regards the clouds will not reap.
Bahnar: Bu lăng kơ kial bơngai noh gô ưh kơ rei; bu lăng kơ hơmơ̆l, sư noh gô ưh kơ năm kĕch yuă.

English: As you do not know what is the way of the wind, Or how the bones grow in the womb of her who is with child, So you do not know the works of God who makes everything.
Bahnar: Kon bơngai ưh kơ băt trong kial tơthu năm tơ yơ, sư kư̆m thoi ưh kơ băt kon nge lăm klak mĕ pơjing thoi yơ, na kư̆m lei-lăi thoi noh mơ̆n, ih ưh kơ hlôh ôh tơdrong jang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Tơ'ngla pơjing kơ tôm tơmam.

English: In the morning sow your seed, And in the evening do not withhold your hand; For you do not know which will prosper, Either this or that, Or whether both alike will be good.
Bahnar: Pơgê hrôih, ih athei drôih rei adrĕch mă-lei gah kơsơ̆ 'nĕ kơ kuăr ti pơdơh; yua kơ ih ưh kơ băt ôh găr ayơ gô chăt 'lơ̆ng, găr 'nâu dah găr to dah pơđĭ 'bar tŏ găr adrĕch noh chăt 'lơ̆ng ngăl hloi.

English: Truly the light is sweet, And it is pleasant for the eyes to behold the sun
Bahnar: Hơdah măt 'năr 'lơ̆ng rŏ dêh, măt lăng 'bôh măt 'năr hiôk pă băt dang yơ.

English: But if a man lives many years And rejoices in them all, Yet let him remember the days of darkness, For they will be many. All that is coming is vanity.
Bahnar: Dah bơngai arih sot 'bôh hơdah đunh sơnăm, lei athei chơt hiôk bĕ tôm dôm lu sơnăm noh; mă-lei athei 'blŏk gô đei năr măng mu kơnê̆ păng gô đei lơ tơdrong tơ anăp bơ̆n ưh tam băt hơđăl thoi yơ tơpă.

English: Rejoice, O young man, in your youth, And let your heart cheer you in the days of your youth; Walk in the ways of your heart, And in the sight of your eyes; But know that for all these God will bring you into judgment.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai hơmuh hơmŏng iĕm hiôk chơt bĕ kơplah oei hơdruh tơdăm, 'nă hal bĕ kơplah oei 'lơ̆p, yak kiơ̆ bĕ thoi jơhngơ̆m ih dui ba, kiơ̆ kơ măt ih lăng, mă-lei iĕm athei băt dôm tơdrong iĕm pơm noh, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô wă sek tơlang kiơ̆ tơdrong noh.

English: Therefore remove sorrow from your heart, And put away evil from your flesh, For childhood and youth are vanity.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, puh tơweh bĕ dôm tơdrong sơ'ngon đơ̆ng lăm jơhngơ̆m păng hiơt bĕ lu tơdrong chhŭr nuih jĭ jăn lăm akâu, yua kơ chăl hơmuh hơmŏng păr hiong kiơ̆ kơ khei 'năr ưh kơ đei yua kiơ.

English: Remember now your Creator in the days of your youth, Before the difficult days come, And the years draw near when you say, “I have no pleasure in them”
Bahnar: 'Blŏk bĕ kơ Tơ'ngla mă pơjing ih kơplah ih oei hơmuh hơmŏng, 'blŏk adrol kơ lu năr kơnê̆ wă truh, adrol kơ lu sơnăm mă ih khan: Inh pă hiôk lu sơnăm 'nâu

English: While the sun and the light, The moon and the stars, Are not darkened, And the clouds do not return after the rain
Bahnar: Adrol kơ măt 'năr, măt khei, lu sơnglŏng ưh pă hơdah dơ̆ng păng hơmơ̆l đông hơlơ̆k đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'mi.

English: In the day when the keepers of the house tremble, And the strong men bow down; When the grinders cease because they are few, And those that look through the windows grow dim
Bahnar: Bơngai gak đĭ tơtơ̆ tơtey lu bơngai pran đĭ gu rŏng, lu bơngai adruh đĭ pơdơh kơ peh yua kơ bơngai tŏ sĕt lu sư tơmang băl trong 'măng-'mŏk gŏk lăng đĭ pă bang.

English: When the doors are shut in the streets, And the sound of grinding is low; When one rises up at the sound of a bird, And all the daughters of music are brought low.
Bahnar: Kơplah 'bar pah 'măng gah trong tang lê̆ re peh rai pă kơtơ̆ng, đơ̆ng nơ̆r sem asi râu tơiung ih hơdơ̆r, nơ̆r hơri chơt rai hơdar.

English: Also they are afraid of height, And of terrors in the way; When the almond tree blossoms, The grasshopper is a burden, And desire fails. For man goes to his eternal home, And the mourners go about the streets.
Bahnar: Kơplah kon bơngai hli kơ lu anih kơjung păng hli krưp tơ rok trong pơlei tih kơplah 'long Almon đei bluh pơkao păng lep mơmŏ trăp trĭn păng kon bơngai ưh pă đei hơpơi kiơ dơ̆ng kơplah kon bơngai brŏk tơ anih sư oei ling-lang ling-lang tơ noh păng bơngai nhơ̆m hmoi kơ bơngai lôch tơ rok trong pơlei tih.

English: Remember your Creator before the silver cord is loosed, Or the golden bowl is broken, Or the pitcher shattered at the fountain, Or the wheel broken at the well.
Bahnar: Adrol kơ tơlei hu tơdrong arih kơtĕch, adrol kơ pơnhan maih pơchah, adrol kơ bô̆i đak pơchah tơ cheng đak glung, adrol kơ tang-wang jơ̆ng gre tơgơ̆ rơkhai 'bơ̆t đak hơlŭng.

English: Then the dust will return to the earth as it was, And the spirit will return to God who gave it.
Bahnar: Păng brŏk tơ teh bơhngol wơ̆t brŏk tơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ'ngla mă pơjing sư.

English: “Vanity of vanities,” says the Preacher, “All is vanity.”
Bahnar: 'Bok mă bơtho noh khan: Đĭ-đăng tôm tơdrong jơ̆ tơdrong kơđei tơdrong kơđei, tơdrong kơđei, kơ̆l 'ngok kon bơngai ưh kơ đei bu hlôh băt tôm tơdrong đei truh tơ kơpal teh âu.

English: And moreover, because the Preacher was wise, he still taught the people knowledge; yes, he pondered and sought out and set in order many proverbs.
Bahnar: Minh 'nu bơngai hơgei, 'bok bơtho sư oei bơtho tơ'bôh tơdrong hơgei ăn kơ kon pơlei. Sư kăl kơ tơ'blŏk hơlen păng pơkeh dôm tơdrong pơđơ̆k.

English: The Preacher sought to find acceptable words; and what was written was upright—words of truth.
Bahnar: 'Bok bơtho adrin nŏng kơ chơchă dôm lu nơ̆r 'lơ̆ng păng dôm lu nơ̆r mă trŏ ling-lang chih tơlĕch tơpăt păng sĭt tơpă.

English: The words of the wise are like goads, and the words of scholars are like well-driven nails, given by one Shepherd.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r bơngai hơgei đei tơdrong pơdrŭt pơm kơ đe 'maih đŏk; sư rơih pơrĕng lu nơ̆r pơđơ̆k 'lơ̆ng kơjăp thoi pơ̆ng kơđĭnh tơ jrăng nơ̆r noh đơ̆ng Tơ'ngla wei triu ră roi.

English: And further, my son, be admonished by these. Of making many books there is no end, and much study is wearisome to the flesh.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, ơ kon ih athei kơchăng bĕ, yua kơ đe chih lơ tơpă hla bơar bơtho ưh kơ tôch păng dah nŏng kơ hŏk pơhrăm đĕch đei pơm kơ akâu gleh lap, pă kĕ.

English: Let us hear the conclusion of the whole matter: Fear God and keep His commandments, For this is man’s all.
Bahnar: Ih đei mơ̆ng boih dôm tơdrong bơtho 'nâu thoi ei: Hli yom bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng wei răk pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r sư tơtă; yua kơ tơdrong đĭ-đăng kon bơngai athei pơm.

English: For God will bring every work into judgment, Including every secret thing, Whether good or evil.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô sek tơlang kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong đêl bơ̆n pơm, pơm 'lơ̆ng dah pơm kơnê̆, mă khan tơdrong kiơ hlơp, sư kư̆m sek tơlang mơ̆n. 25-Nov-2005@13:33, Backup Description=25-Nov-2005@13:30, Billy - 29-Nov-2005@10:12, Backup Description=25-Nov-2005@16:45, David Le vp - 29-Nov-2005@10:23, Backup Description=29-Nov-2005@10:21, Billy
